meanings.definition: An expanse of short grass or vegetation
meanings.sent1: The sward in the park was soft under our feet.
meanings.sent2: The horses grazed peacefully on the lush sward.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy rolled around in the sward, getting grass stains everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The sward stretched out like a green carpet, inviting picnickers to relax.
meanings.sent5: The morning dew glistened on the sward, creating a magical scene.

meanings.definition: To cover with grass or vegetation
meanings.sent1: She decided to sward the barren land to make it more fertile.
meanings.sent2: The gardener swarded the yard, transforming it into a beautiful garden.
meanings.sent3: The kids playfully swarded each other with grass clippings during the game.
meanings.sent4: Nature swards the hills with a blanket of green every spring.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush seemed to sward the canvas with strokes of vibrant colors.
